text: Python string operation, extract text between html tags
(it outputs over two lines, so there must be a \n in there.
I wish to extract the string that's in between the <font></font> tags.
In this case, it's JUL 28, but it might be another date or some other number.
1) The best way to extract the value from between the font tags?
I was thinking I could extract everything in between "> and </.
